sharek.shortest_path

Class PQ

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection
      • sharek.shortest_path.PQ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection

    public class PQ
extends java.util.AbstractCollection
    This class implements a priority queue

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PQ()
      constructs an empty priority queue, when new elements are added their natural order will be used to determine which is minimal.
      PQ(java.util.Collection coll)
      all elements in coll are added to the priority queue.
      PQ(java.util.Comparator comp)
      constructs an empty priority queue, when new elements are added the Comparator comp determines which is smaller.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(java.lang.Object o)
      A new element o is added to the priority queue in O(log n) time where n is the size of the priority queue.
      boolean contains(java.lang.Long id)
      Contains.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if is empty.
      java.util.Iterator iterator()
      The order of the elements returned by the iterator is not specified.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      simple test harnass that inserts all arguments into a priority queue and then removes them one at a time and prints them one per line as they are removed thus effectively sorting in O(n log n) time.
      java.lang.Object peek()
      Executes in O(1) time, returns smallest element.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PQ

        public PQ()
        constructs an empty priority queue, when new elements are added their natural order will be used to determine which is minimal. This means elements that are added must implement the Comparable interface and must be mutually comparable, i.e., e1.compareTo(e2) must not throw a CastCastException for any two elements e1 and e2 in the priority queue.

      • PQ

        public PQ(java.util.Comparator comp)
        constructs an empty priority queue, when new elements are added the Comparator comp determines which is smaller.
        Parameters:
        comp - is the Comparator used in determining order

      • PQ

        public PQ(java.util.Collection coll)
        all elements in coll are added to the priority queue. The complexity is O(n) where coll.size() == n
        Parameters:
        coll - is a collection of mutually comparable elements

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(java.lang.Object o)
        A new element o is added to the priority queue in O(log n) time where n is the size of the priority queue.

        The return value should be ignored, a boolean value must be returned because of the requirements of the Collection interface.

        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Collection
        Overrides:
        add in class java.util.AbstractCollection
        Parameters:
        o - is the (Comparable) object added to the priority queue
        Returns:
        true

        Size.

        Specified by:

        the number of elements in the priority queue

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if is empty.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface java.util.Collection
        Overrides:
        isEmpty in class java.util.AbstractCollection
        Returns:
        true if and only if the priority queue is empty

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove()
        The smallest/minimal element is removed and returned in O(log n) time where n is the size of the priority queue.
        Returns:
        the smallest element (and removes it)

      • peek

        public java.lang.Object peek()
        Executes in O(1) time, returns smallest element.
        Returns:
        the minimal element in the priority queue

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator iterator()
        The order of the elements returned by the iterator is not specified.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.util.Collection
        Specified by:
        iterator in class java.util.AbstractCollection
        Returns:
        an iterator of all elements in priority queue

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Long id)
        Contains.
        Parameters:
        id - the id
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        simple test harnass that inserts all arguments into a priority queue and then removes them one at a time and prints them one per line as they are removed thus effectively sorting in O(n log n) time.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments
